comment_text: Hi everyone! You might have noticed this is a reupload. That's because we made a mistake (turns out diphtheria is super weird!), and while that mistake didn't undermine our overall point, we care about making our videos totally accurate. So we took it down and fixed the error, and we hope you enjoy the revised version.

Anybody with AB - or AB + blood type can donate plasma and platelets to a lot of people.  AB - is the universal donor for plasma and platelets because we don't produce antibodies to the A antigen, the B antigen nor do we carry the Rh + antigen.  On the down side, AB + and especially AB - are super rare.
only young virgin blood can be used save the elite !

You do know that there are a few dozen companies around America that can reproduce human antibodies to produce huge quantities of 'synthetic' copies of those antibodies?  All you do is find a few people who have recovered from the virus, test their antibodies to find out which ones are the best at fighting off the virus, and then mass-produce those in the form of synthetic copies, enough for every single person in America to take an injection of those antibodies.  It is not a 'vaccine' since your body does not produce its own antibodies, it simply accepts the synthetic antibodies and allows them to do their job. Since those synthetic antibodies last only about one year, it will be necessary to get a fresh injection of antibodies every year as long as the virus remains a problem in the community.  When the pandemic dies down then no need for booster shots, but when the virus flares up again then booster shots of antibodies to the virus will be required once more.  The nice thing is that this type of treatment does not carry any negative side effects the way a vaccine would carry.  The body won't suffer that dreaded 'cytokine storm' that kills people after a 'BAD' vaccine is created and given to people.
